verses.verse: And the men<WH376> of Ephraim<WH669> said<WH559> to him, Why<WH4100> have you served<WH6213> us thus,<WH1697> <WH2007> that you called<WH7121> us not, when<WH3588> you went<WH1980> to fight<WH3898> with the Midianites?<WH4080> And they did chide<WH7378> with him sharply.<WH2394>

And he said<WH559> to them, What<WH4100> have I done<WH6213> now<WH6258> in comparison of you? Is not the gleaning<WH5955> of the grapes of Ephraim<WH669> better<WH2896> than the vintage<WH1210> of Abiezer?<WH44>

God<WH430> has delivered<WH5414> into your hands<WH3027> the princes<WH8269> of Midian,<WH4080> Oreb<WH6157> and Zeeb:<WH2062> and what<WH4100> was I able<WH3201> to do<WH6213> in comparison of you? Then<WH227> their anger<WH7307> was abated<WH7503> toward him, when he had said<WH1696> that.
And Gideon<WH1439> came<WH935> to Jordan,<WH3383> and passed<WH5674> over,<WH5674> he, and the three<WH7969> hundred<WH3967> men<WH376> that were with him, faint,<WH5889> yet pursuing<WH7291> them.

And he said<WH559> to the men<WH582> of Succoth,<WH5523> Give,<WH5414> I pray<WH4994> you, loaves<WH3603> of bread<WH3899> to the people<WH5971> that follow<WH7272> me; for they be faint,<WH5889> and I am pursuing<WH7291> after<WH310> Zebah<WH2078> and Zalmunna,<WH6759> kings<WH4428> of Midian.<WH4080>

And the princes<WH8269> of Succoth<WH5523> said,<WH559> Are the hands<WH3709> of Zebah<WH2078> and Zalmunna<WH6759> now<WH6258> in your hand,<WH3027> that we should give<WH5414> bread<WH3899> to your army?<WH6635>

And Gideon<WH1439> said,<WH559> Therefore when the LORD<WH3068> has delivered<WH5414> Zebah<WH2078> and Zalmunna<WH6759> into my hand,<WH3027> then I will tear<WH1758> your flesh<WH1320> with the thorns<WH6975> of the wilderness<WH4057> and with briers.<WH1303>

And he went<WH5927> up there<WH8033> to Penuel,<WH6439> and spoke<WH1696> to them likewise:<WH2063> and the men<WH582> of Penuel<WH6439> answered<WH6030> him as the men<WH582> of Succoth<WH5523> had answered<WH6030> him.
And he spoke<WH559> also<WH1571> to the men<WH582> of Penuel,<WH6439> saying,<WH559> When I come<WH7725> again<WH7725> in peace,<WH7965> I will break<WH5422> down<WH5422> this tower.<WH4026>

Now Zebah<WH2078> and Zalmunna<WH6759> were in Karkor,<WH7174> and their hosts<WH4264> with them, about fifteen<WH2568> <WH6240> thousand<WH505> men, all<WH3605> that were left<WH3498> of all<WH3605> the hosts<WH4264> of the children<WH1121> of the east:<WH6924> for there fell<WH5307> an hundred<WH3967> and twenty<WH6242> thousand<WH505> men<WH376> that drew<WH8025> sword.<WH2719>

And Gideon<WH1439> went<WH5927> up by the way<WH1870> of them that dwelled<WH7931> in tents<WH168> on the east<WH6924> of Nobah<WH5025> and Jogbehah,<WH3011> and smote<WH5221> the host;<WH4264> for the host<WH4264> was secure.<WH983>

And when Zebah<WH2078> and Zalmunna<WH6759> fled,<WH5127> he pursued<WH7291> after<WH310> them, and took<WH3920> the two<WH8147> kings<WH4428> of Midian,<WH4080> Zebah<WH2078> and Zalmunna,<WH6759> and discomfited<WH2729> all<WH3605> the host.<WH4264>
And Gideon<WH1439> the son<WH1121> of Joash<WH3101> returned<WH7725> from battle<WH4421> before<WH4608> the sun<WH2775> was up,

And caught<WH3920> a young<WH5288> man of the men<WH582> of Succoth,<WH5523> and inquired<WH7592> of him: and he described<WH3789> to him the princes<WH8269> of Succoth,<WH5523> and the elders<WH2205> thereof, even three score<WH7657> and seventeen<WH7657> <WH7651> men.<WH376>

And he came<WH935> to the men<WH582> of Succoth,<WH5523> and said,<WH559> Behold<WH2009> Zebah<WH2078> and Zalmunna,<WH6759> with whom<WH834> you did upbraid<WH2778> me, saying,<WH559> Are the hands<WH3709> of Zebah<WH2078> and Zalmunna<WH6759> now<WH6258> in your hand,<WH3027> that we should give<WH5414> bread<WH3899> to your men<WH582> that are weary?<WH3286>
And he took<WH3947> the elders<WH2205> of the city,<WH5892> and thorns<WH6975> of the wilderness<WH4057> and briers,<WH1303> and with them he taught<WH3045> the men<WH582> of Succoth.<WH5523>
And he beat<WH5422> down<WH5422> the tower<WH4026> of Penuel,<WH6439> and slew<WH2026> the men<WH582> of the city.<WH5892>

Then said<WH559> he to Zebah<WH2078> and Zalmunna,<WH6759> What<WH375> manner of men<WH582> were they whom<WH834> you slew<WH2026> at Tabor?<WH8396> And they answered,<WH559> As you are, so<WH1992> were they; each one<WH259> resembled<WH8389> the children<WH1121> of a king.<WH4428>

And he said,<WH559> They were my brothers,<WH251> even the sons<WH1121> of my mother:<WH517> as the LORD<WH3068> lives,<WH2416> if<WH3863> you had saved<WH2421> them alive,<WH2421> I would not slay<WH2026> you.

And he said<WH559> to Jether<WH3500> his firstborn,<WH1060> Up, and slay<WH2026> them. But the youth<WH5288> drew<WH8025> not his sword:<WH2719> for he feared,<WH3372> because<WH3588> he was yet<WH5750> a youth.<WH5288>

Then Zebah<WH2078> and Zalmunna<WH6759> said,<WH559> Rise<WH6965> you, and fall<WH6293> on us: for as the man<WH376> is, so is his strength.<WH1369> And Gideon<WH1439> arose,<WH6965> and slew<WH2026> Zebah<WH2078> and Zalmunna,<WH6759> and took<WH3947> away the ornaments<WH7720> that were on their camels'<WH1581> necks.<WH6677>

Then the men<WH376> of Israel<WH3478> said<WH559> to Gideon,<WH1439> Rule<WH4910> you over us, both<WH1571> you, and your son,<WH1121> and your son's<WH1121> son<WH1121> also:<WH1571> for you have delivered<WH3467> us from the hand<WH3027> of Midian.<WH4080>
And Gideon<WH1439> said<WH559> to them, I will not rule<WH4910> over you, neither<WH3808> shall my son<WH1121> rule<WH4910> over you: the LORD<WH3068> shall rule<WH4910> over you.

And Gideon<WH1439> said<WH559> to them, I would desire<WH7592> a request<WH7596> of you, that you would give<WH5414> me every man<WH376> the earrings<WH5141> of his prey.<WH7998> (For they had golden<WH2091> earrings,<WH5141> because<WH3588> they were Ishmaelites.<WH3459>)

And they answered,<WH559> We will willingly<WH5414> give<WH5414> them. And they spread<WH6566> a garment,<WH8071> and did cast<WH7993> therein<WH8033> every man<WH376> the earrings<WH5141> of his prey.<WH7998>

And the weight<WH4948> of the golden<WH2091> earrings<WH5141> that he requested<WH7592> was a thousand<WH505> and seven<WH7651> hundred<WH3967> shekels of gold;<WH2091> beside<WH905> ornaments,<WH7720> and collars,<WH5188> and purple<WH713> raiment<WH899> that was on<WH5921> the kings<WH4428> of Midian,<WH4080> and beside<WH905> the chains<WH6060> that were about their camels'<WH1581> necks.<WH6677>

And Gideon<WH1439> made<WH6213> an ephod<WH646> thereof, and put<WH3322> it in his city,<WH5892> even in Ophrah:<WH6084> and all<WH3605> Israel<WH3478> went thither<WH8033> a whoring<WH2181> after<WH310> it: which thing became<WH1961> a snare<WH4170> to Gideon,<WH1439> and to his house.<WH1004>

Thus was Midian<WH4080> subdued<WH3665> before<WH6440> the children<WH1121> of Israel,<WH3478> so that they lifted<WH5375> up their heads<WH7218> no<WH3808> more.<WH3254> And the country<WH776> was in quietness<WH8252> forty<WH705> years<WH8141> in the days<WH3117> of Gideon.<WH1439>
And Jerubbaal<WH3378> the son<WH1121> of Joash<WH3101> went<WH3212> and dwelled<WH3427> in his own house.<WH1004>
And Gideon<WH1439> had three score<WH7657> and ten sons<WH1121> of his body<WH3409> begotten:<WH3318> for he had<WH1961> many<WH7227> wives.<WH802>
And his concubine<WH6370> that was in Shechem,<WH7927> she also<WH1571> bore<WH3205> him a son,<WH1121> whose<WH853> name<WH8034> he called<WH7760> Abimelech.<WH40>

And Gideon<WH1439> the son<WH1121> of Joash<WH3101> died<WH4191> in a good<WH2896> old<WH7872> age,<WH7872> and was buried<WH6912> in the sepulcher<WH6913> of Joash<WH3101> his father,<WH1> in Ophrah<WH6084> of the Abiezrites.<WH33>

And it came<WH1961> to pass, as soon<WH834> as Gideon<WH1439> was dead,<WH4191> that the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> turned<WH7725> again,<WH7725> and went a whoring<WH2181> after<WH310> Baalim,<WH1168> and made<WH7760> Baalberith<WH1170> their god.<WH430>

And the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> remembered<WH2142> not the LORD<WH3068> their God,<WH430> who had delivered<WH5337> them out of the hands<WH3027> of all<WH3605> their enemies<WH341> on every<WH5437> side:<WH5439>

Neither<WH3808> showed<WH6213> they kindness<WH2617> to the house<WH1004> of Jerubbaal,<WH3378> namely, Gideon,<WH1439> according to all<WH3605> the goodness<WH2896> which he had showed<WH6213> to Israel.<WH3478>
